alert.note: Alert for Logan; Morgan; Washington; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 11:08AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern Washington and portions of southwestern Logan, northeastern Morgan, and northeastern Weld Counties. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1104 AM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Akron, Otis, Merino, Prewitt Reservoir, Midway, Atwood, Platner, Burdett, Logan Corners, Willard, Pawnee Pass, Lone Star, Antelope Springs, Stoneham, Fremont Butte, Messex, Union and Hyde. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 76 between mile markers 98 and 122.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
